str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Of Chaldee origin; date-house; Beth-any, a place in Palestine.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: From kata and keimai; to lie down, i.e. be sick; specially, to recline at a meal.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.
Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A leprous person, a leper. From the same as lepra; scaly, i.e. Leprous.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To come, go.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: To have, hold, possess. Including an alternate form scheo skheh'-o; a primary verb; to hold.
Neuter of alabastros, the name of a stone; properly, an 'alabaster' box, i.e. a perfume vase.
Very costly, very precious, of great value. From polus and telos; extremely expensive.
Anointing-oil, ointment. Probably of foreign origin; 'myrrh', i.e. perfumed oil.
Genuine, pure (of ointment), trustworthy. From pistis; trustworthy, i.e. Genuine.
Spikenard, a perfume made originally from a plant growing on the Himalayas. Of foreign origin; 'nard'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: From sun and the base of tribos; to crush completely, i.e. To shatter.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of alabastros, the name of a stone; properly, an 'alabaster' box, i.e. a perfume vase.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To pour (down) upon. From kata and cheo; to pour down.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From the primary kapto; the head, literally or figuratively.
